snippet.title: Argyle Foods beefs up with new investors
snippet.content:
An interesting transaction has emerged in Argyle Foods Group, which is backed by Dick Honan's Manildra Group and owned and run by the Graham family. Street Talk can reveal a consortium of local and offshore investors have taken a large minority stake in the NSW-based producer of beef and lamb. The group includes high net worth investors, family offices and a unit of Hong Kong-listed Dah Chong Hong Holdings. The transaction is said to be worth about $20 million and given the mix of participants has secured Foreign Investment Review Board approval. Argyle is owned and run by Lachlan and Bryce Graham, the fourth generation of the Graham family in the business. , owns a stake in Argyle.
Argyle has a branded presence in more than 2000 retail outlets. Sources said the new capital would be deployed to help a direct push into China's retail market as well as a vertical integration of the business from genetics, breeding, fattening, processing through to sales, marketing and distribution.
DCH and Argyle's plans include expansion into Greater China and establishing a processing plant in that market. The timing is interesting as six Australian meat companies confront temporary selling bans in China. Argyle's export markets in the region, do however, already include Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan, Cambodia and Korea.
